thread.title: Heat extend winning streak to eight games after beating Nets | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Heat extend winning streak to eight games after beating Nets | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Heat extend winning streak to eight games after beating Nets | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 31, 2017 2:08am EST January 31, 2017 12:39am EST Waiters steps up again! NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 31, 2017 
Jan. 31, 2017 
The Miami Heat extended their winning streak to eight games after taking care of the Brooklyn Nets 104-96 on the road. 
MORE: Wolves come up clutch in overtime to beat Magic 
After being named Eastern Conference Player of the Week , Dion Waiters again led the way with 19 points and nine assists. 
Five players finished in double figures on the night, Goran Dragic added 20, whilst James Johnson came off the bench to chip in 17 points. 
Miami made the Nets pay from deep, connecting on 11 three-pointers, outscoring them 33-12 from range. 
Fueled by a 17-0 run just before half-time, Miami rallied to take 56-52 at the main break, but it was their defence that led them there, mainly thanks to the impenetrable Hassan Whiteside who continually turned Brooklyn away at the basket. Hassan Whiteside with the thundering rejection against Brooklyn pic.twitter.com/c1RMvemz64 â€” NBA Australia (@NBA_AU) January 31, 2017 
The Nets did get back to wthin four points with two minutes remaining, but Miami then scored six straight points to ice the game. 
Brooklyn has now lost six games in a row and 17 of their last 18. 
Miami will look to continue their winning streak when they host Atlanta on Thursday AEDT.
